item.title: Employment Agencies: Consented illegality?
item.description: By Luís Almeida Pinto No one controls greed, nor does it supervise the illegal collection of fees by employment agencies in Macao? According to the stipulated in Article 28 (3)) and No. 4 of Law No. 16/2020, of 14 September, the total amount of fees to be charged for employment agencies to workers cannot exceed 50% of the base compensation of the first month, established in the employment contract, and employment agencies can only charge workers for the provision of services for one time, and 60 days after the date of the employment date, except the case. Special working relationship duration is less than 60 days, and may then charge workers, only once, on the day of termination of the employment relationship. Now, this is not what is going on today in the generality of employment agency situations in Macau. The difficulties felt by foreign workers looking for Macao to have a job and a better salary, since the amounts charged here by employment agencies to workers reach MOP $ 20,000, or even more, for jobs whose monthly salaries do not exceed ten thousand patacas, and often the fees required in advance, and not charged when the worker receives the expiration. And all of this has been impuning with many years, without any control on the part of Macao authorities, nor can you realize the existence of oversight of employment agencies, all for the benefit of the greed of the owners of employment agencies, and in serious loss of foreign workers who seek a job in Macao, for having great economic needs, and trying to find better conditions of living, for themselves and for their family. See, as a good example, what happens in the neighboring Special Administrative Region of Hong Kong: In accordance with the relevant provisions of the Employment Ordinance (chap. 57) and the Regulation of Employment Agencies (Chapter 57a), the maximum amount that an agency can legally charge a domestic worker, which constitutes a large part of the foreign workforce in Hong Kong, is 10% of the first month of salary. Any agency that covers more than this amount prescribed is breaking the law, and in Hong Kong, employment agencies are actually inspected and fined, with sanctions that include the suspension and revocation of business licenses. It is time to be required to the authorities to end the illegal practices of employment agencies in Macau!

item.title: Sexual health is complex - and still well
item.description: At a time when more and more mental health is spoken, public discussion about sexual health remains shy - often limited to topics such as sexually transmitted infections (IST) or unwanted pregnancy. The article recently published in the International Journal of Sexual Health, by Manão, Brazão and Pascoal, entitled “How to Halth Sexual? The qualitative analysis of people's perceptions”, gives us some of the complexity of the concept from the perspective of people. The study, which analyzes the answers of 151 participants in Portugal to the open question “What does sexual health mean?”, Offers a multifaceted portrait. The first relevant conclusion is that for these people, sexual health is not limited to the absence of illness. For many respondents, it is a reality that encompasses the body, but also emotions, relationships, personal autonomy and the social and political context. This view meets the broader definition proposed by the World Health Organization, a proposal that takes into account the many factors that influence health and well-being in different ways. Emerging themes - about the physicality of sex, autonomy, relational and intimate issues, and sexual justice - reveal a progressive evolution in the face of the traditional vision (biomedical and genital) in the sense of a more inclusive and contextual concept. It is revealing, for example, that many participants associate sexual health with the ability to feel pleasure, to communicate desires with their partner or to feel respected in their choices. At a time when issues of sexuality from the discipline of citizenship in Portuguese schools are withdrawn in response to unfounded “ideological” fears, studies such as this show the importance of continuing to openly discuss sexuality - and, in particular, sexual health. This must be understood as a complex multifactorial system that requires spaces of equality, respect and freedom to be who is, without fear of discrimination. It is essential that sexual health is fully integrated into health models, so that its epistemic strength gains new vigor. The absence of prejudice, the existence of inclusive public policies and the equitable access to sexual health services were identified by some participants as structuring elements, so that each person can effectively take care of their sexual health. Sexuality, after all, is not only a private subject, but also a political field. Another relevant aspect concerns individual liability, reflected in the theme of autonomy. Many participants recognize that it is up to each person to take care of their sexuality, seek information, communicate with their partner and, when necessary, resort to specialized services. This autonomy is undoubtedly essential. However, the exclusive emphasis on personal responsibility can easily slip into a logic of healthism - an ideology that transfers the weight of health entirely to the individual, ignoring social, economic and cultural determinants. It is precisely here that the critical perspective of the article - and this field of study - becomes fundamental: it is not enough to promote sexual health as an individual choice; It is necessary to create structural conditions so that this choice is really possible. Sexual health is more than an office or classroom theme; It is part of the mechanisms of meaning that support social life. It is a direct reflection of the society we build. The type of sexual health we promote reveals a lot about our collective values - how we value the body, freedom, respect and justice. It should be borne in mind that, despite the conceptual sophistication evidenced in this study, it is a sample of 151 people, mostly with higher education, collected through a snowball sampling technique - that is, the participants were referred to each other. We cannot ignore that these data represent a situated view, not necessarily widespread to the general population. Which means that there are more forms of understanding that may not be accepted, many of them that may still be problematic or undesirable. Any attempt to deconstruct health biomedical models in favor of a broader social-political approach is, in fact, of utmost importance. Sexual health is not only defined by the absence of viruses or bacteria, but by a more complete understanding of well-being, in which socio-political factors need to be analyzed, understood and, in some situations, transformed. If for a while this was a relevant job, now it is urgent work.

item.title: Financial management
item.description: An online communication agency of Macau reported that a cybernaut was circulating (whom we will call John) where he said he had a monthly income of 30,000 patacas, but that he was with financial embarrassment because he was single, had bought a house and paid the installments to the bank, had monthly expenses, had no savings and asked how to do to improve his situation. Many cybernauts answered this publication, asking the reason for the high expenses, if they were due to careless spending, if they had bad habits, etc. Many of them highlighted that a way to manage money is to “increase income”. John could look for part-time work or change jobs to make more money. Others suggested that if he lives alone and has a free room could rent him. If I rent the room, John may also consider cooking socks with the tenant to reduce food expenses. Another important principle of financial management is the creation of “savings”, which implies “reducing expenses to the very least”. Therefore, the cybernauts asked John how much he paid to the bank for the provision of the house and if there would be the possibility of renegotiating it. Others suggested that they shop in mainland China to reduce expenses. Keeping expenses but increasing revenues, John may have a financial surplus, which can apply to daily spending and savings. On the other hand, with the same income and reduced expenses, it can obtain the same result and achieve your desire to save money. Which of the two options is better? If you reduce expenses but keep the same income, you will only be able to save a little. If you increase income, you will have several sources of revenue and future financial growth will be higher, and you can still create savings to ensure “times of need”. How much do you need to spare to collect “times of need”? Two million? Three million? We will discuss this issue next week. To achieve prudent financial management, beyond the above advice, John has to consider two questions. First, what is the objective of financial management? Second, what is the financial management model? The purpose of the financial management of most people is to make them richer. If you are richer means you have more money to spend in the future, then you will have to have expenditure on expenses. To achieve this goal, John must set different temporal goals. For example, increase the performance between 5% and 25% within a year, changing jobs or getting more part-time work, then having your own business within five years, etc. After getting his goal, John can give himself a gift, such as a two -month trip to Europe, buy a good car, etc. Of course, both traveling and shopping are ways of getting satisfaction through consumption. John can only be truly happy when he reaches his goals. If it only spends money impensely, it will have a brief happiness and will be on its way to the financial disaster and may pay a very high price, so it must be very careful. Another purpose of financial management is to increase savings to have more resources in the future, increasing their quality of life. For example, having more money to pay the house at full earlier and get a state of “financial semi-freedom”; This method is better than spending in a thoughtless way. After setting these objectives, the next step is to consider the model to use to measure your financial performance. The average monthly yield in Macao is about 20,000 patacas. John currently earns 30,000, exceeding the average salary. John owns a house. With a monthly yield of 30,000 patacas, your financial level is very good. After establishing the model and the financial objectives, there are two points to note. First, the publication did not mention whether or not John was in love. If you want to get married, your home will be subject to the Macao Family Law and the property can be changed. John must think carefully in the way of dealing with this issue. Secondly, the value of the house is high, but if liquidity is low, the performance may vary depending on market fluctuations. The real estate market is currently slow. If most capital is invested in the house and suddenly it is necessary to have available a high amount, there will be a financial problem and John has to be more careful. Increasing income and reducing expenses, living within our possibilities, and increasing savings are the basic principles of personal financial management; But we must also have objectives and clarify our financial growth. We can only guarantee that our financial situation is consistent with our socio-economic framework, and that we are not demanding more or less of ourselves when we adopt the correct financial standards. We must also make the appropriate adjustments to our financial goals based on our own circumstances, ensure that we have enough money to cover daily expenses and have plans to precipate future changes, so that we can enjoy the happiness that money gives us. David Chan Legal Consultant of the Association for the Promotion of Jazz in Macau Associate Professor at the Faculty of Management Sciences, Macau Polytechnic University Email: cbchan@mpu.edu.mo

item.title: Macau Museum | Exhibition marks centenary of death Sun Yat-sen
item.description:
The Macao Museum hosts, from August 8, an exhibition on the southern passage of China, including Macao and Hong Kong, from Sun Yat-Sen, doctor, revolutionary and one of the protagonists of the 1911 Chinese Republican Revolution. Macao ”
The MSAR hosts an exhibition that tells the life story of Sun Yat-Sen, the most revolutionary full-body than a doctor, who went through Guangdong, Macao and Hong Kong and who was one of the main responsible for the 1911 Republican Revolution that led to the fall of the imperial regime. Sun Yat-Sen eventually became known as “the father of China” to have contributed to the construction of a new nation. According to a statement from the Cultural Institute (IC), the show “From Patient Healing to Salvation of a Nation-Dr. Sun Yat-Sen in Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macau” will be inaugurated on August 8 at the Macao Museum and aims to commemorate the centenary of the death of Sun Yat-sen. This is a jointly organized initiative by the IC, the Hong Kong government's cultural and leisure department and the Zhongshan Department of Culture, Radio and Tourism, without forgetting the Dr. Sun Yat-Sen Museum in Hong Kong, which hosted the show in June. The exhibition, which can be visited until October 12, pays “a profound tribute to the lasting contributions of Dr. Sun Yat-sen to the revitalization of the nation and the happiness of the people”, describes the IC, which is a traveling exhibition that is born “from a project of cooperation between the cultural entities of Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macau”. The show includes a hundred pieces or collections of historical images, documents and “valuable historical relics” of the Sun Yat-Sen passage through Guangdong, Macao and Hong Kong. The story by phases The whole exhibition space is divided into four parts, entitled “The Cradle of Thought on the Salvation of the Nation”, “The Cradle of Revolution”, “The Natal Regions of the Family”, “Memorials for the Great Spirit”. In all these spaces the public can “remember Dr. Sun's course and revolutionary career in Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macau,” says the IC, presenting “the profound calls of Dr. Sun with Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macau, expressing the deep respect of these three regions” by this revolutionary. In addition to the exhibition, a film related to political personality will be projected, and is also released an online exhibition, using virtual reality, after the inauguration, in order to facilitate the viewing of the contents by the public. According to information provided by the Digital Library of the Jorge Álvares Foundation, Sun Yat-Sen was born within a natural modest family in the village of Cuiheng, province of Guangdong. Sun's father had been in Macao working as a shoemaker, and then returned to China where he formed a family. Sun Yat-Sen was born on November 11, 1866 and set out to Hawaii, 13-year-old Hawaii to meet his older brother. Studied medicine in Honolulu and Hong Kong. It was during this time that it aroused its revolutionary vein. He left for Macao at the conclusion of the degree in 1892, having exercised Western medicine at the Kiang Wu Hospital and, later, in a clinic founded by herself on Rua das Estlagês. "In 1894, already deeply involved in politics, he founded society for China's regeneration that aimed to overthrow the imperial regime and install a democratic government. The following year, he even participated in an attempted coup in Guangzhou, but the coup failed, and was forced to flee, exiling in Japan. During the years of exile, he traveled to the United States, Canada and Europe." Digital Library. Still in Japan, he founded the United Alliance Society that came from the Kuomitang Party. Despite his ideological role in the revolutionary struggle, Sun Yat-Sen was abroad when the imperial system fell in China on 10 October 1911, and was for a short period president of the New Republic of China.

item.title: Art Macao | Artists project The Haas Brothers to see in Cod
item.description:
There is another exhibition integrated in the poster of “Art Macao: Macau International Art Biennial 2025”. This time the public will have the opportunity to see the project “The Haas Brothers: Clair de Lun”, evident at City of Dreams
Following the presentation at The A4 Art Museum in Chengdu last year, he is “Clair de Lune”, the work of artists The Haas Brothers arrives in Macau, integrated on the “Art Macao: International Art Biennial of Macau 2025”, in the special exhibition section. Available for visits at City of Dreams (COD), Cotai, until September 12, “Clair de Lune” presents a series of pieces and facilities of the two brothers born in Austin, Texas, in a “trip where memory and emotion converge in an immersive art world”, describes the Cod in a note. In “Clair de Lune”, light becomes a “metaphor, building an emotionally rich narrative that is accompanied by an anthropomorphic character”, which is a COD bet on “exploration of art and commitment to multidisciplinary culture”. Also according to the same note, this exhibition “reflects the consistent creative philosophy of artists”, who seek to “break barriers between disciplines, activate the senses and evoke an emotional resonance”, and the name of the show refers to the composition of French Claude Debussy, “Clair de Lune”. The Haas Brothers also sought inspiration from the childhood memories of the so -called "Moon Towers" [Moon Towers], structures used to illuminate Austin at night. For the two brothers, these towers "have become a last symbol of their childhood memories, surpassing the line between the true moon and the artificial moon." Here, the moon becomes a metaphor "for emotional migration, in which the flow of light represents the two paths of a journey between 'coming and leaving'. Thus, the public is invited to enjoy and interpret these games of light and shadows, building a journey of "perception, reflection and emotional exploitation." Six pieces with meaning "Clair de Lune" in Cod, includes six facilities that "build a poetic and imaginative world" in connection with the moon, presenting five sculptures with lamps inspired by the moon towers, with names such as "The Street Named Desire", "Let There Be Street Light", "A Light in the Streets and Freak In The Sheets ”,“ Lamp of Approval ”and“ Light to Remain Silent ”. The works, with “evocative titles and expressive forms”, constitute “a reflection of themes such as desire, recognition or silence”. The sixth piece presented, "Reach-Able Moment" presents a character similar to a monkey that "symbolizes the search, not only for love, patience and devotion, but also for deeper meaning," such as "peaceful and philosophical reflection of the meaning of existence." The Haas Brothers are Simon and Nikolai Haas, currently living in Los Angeles. In recent years “developed a multidisciplinary and distinct artistic language, working with fashion, cinema, music and creative design”. Its artistic practice “continues to expand the possibilities of artistic expression by challenging conventional environments”, presenting “an anthropomorphic approach” in “experimentation of shapes and materials”. In this process, both "question and respond to the social functions of art and contexts of the culture where they inhabit." More concretely about "Clair de Lune" and the power of moonlight, the two artists mentioned, cited by the same note, that it is something "fleeting, but powerful", that "changes everything in which it touches, which transforms the common into something fantastic." "This transformation is what we are later. If we can take the observer to a quiet, humorous and reflection world, then we did our work as artists," they said.

item.title: Banking | Less 429 automatic boxes within five years
item.description:
For every five starting boxes in operation in 2020, only four remain today. However, the number of terminals for making electronic payments has grown from about 70,000 to almost 110,000
From the end of 2020, to the end, banks have made available 429 automatic (or ATM boxes) to the population. The most recent number, referring to the end of June this year, was advanced to HM by the Macao Monetary Authority (AMCM), and contrasts with the greatest use of other forms of electronic payments. According to data advanced by AMCM, in late June there were a total of 1,358 automatic boxes in operation. This number shows that compared to the end of 2024 there was even an increase in the number of boxes to work, with 29 more units. However, compared to the end of 2020, the year when there were more automatic boxes to work, the fall has happened practically constantly. At the end of 2020 were in operation 1,787 automatic boxes, the largest number recorded at least since 2016. Compared to June 2025, there was a reduction of 429 automatic boxes, the equivalent of 24 percent decrease. This reduction means that for every five boxes operating at the end of 2020 one is no longer available. The reduction has been progressively, but has accelerated in recent years, except for the first six months of this year. Between 2020 and 2021 only nine boxes are no longer available. However, between 2021 and 2022, the decrease was 221 units, or 12.4 percent. Between 2022 and 2023 the breaking of the number of automatic boxes was slower, with a reduction 56 units to 1.501, when it was once 1,557. Between 2023 and last year the reduction was accelerating to the rate of 11.5 percent, with 172 machines in operation, which meant that 2024 ended with 1,358 machines to operate. Other alternatives The closing of banks' automatic boxes contrasts with the reality of payments through mobile phone applications that have continually expanded in the last five years. In late 2020, according to the statistics published in January 2021 by AMCM, there were about 70,000 machines that accepted mobile payments. However, in the first quarter of 2020, the number of machines was about 43,000, which means that within 12 months the number almost doubled it. Throughout this year the value of transactions with mobile payments was approximately 6.31 billion patacas. However, the first trimester numbers of 2025 show a higher implementation of this type of payments, a trend to which the Ho IAT SENG government also used the electronic payment means to assign consumption support during the pandemic. According to the latest data at the end of March 2025, AMCM accounted for 108,749 terminals for mobile payments. And only in the first quarter the value of transactions reached 7.9 billion patacas. AMCM data also show that throughout 2024 there was a total of 30.3 billion transacted patacas through electronic payments. item.title: Japan | Tsunami alert does not impact macau residents
item.description:
Yesterday a tsunami warning was issued in Japan due to the earthquake on the Russian Peninsula of Kamchatka. A representative of travel agencies stated that 10 macao excursionists were in Hokkaido, where some zones had evacuation notice. Residents are safe and there were no requests for help
The occurrence of an earthquake yesterday in the Kamchatka zone in Russia caused a wave of tsunami alerts and evacuation measures in various regions with the Pacific Ocean, and Japan is no exception. According to information provided by Paul Wong, president of the Macao Tourist Industry Association, ten residents of Macao who are making a tour in the Japanese region of Hokkaido are safe. In the statements made to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, Paul Wong added that this group of ten people should return to Macau soon. In addition, the official confirmed that the travel agencies of the territory have made contacts to realize how many residents of Macau are traveling in Japan individual, and none of them made requests for help or support. Paul Wong also said that in August there will be dozens of macao tour in Hokkaido and that, for now, there were no cancellations of the trips. About two million people in Japan yesterday received orders to abandon their homes or coastal areas due to the risk of tsunami. The earthquake, which occurred on the Kamchatka Russian Peninsula, was magnitude of 8.8, and in Hokkaido, the largest island in the Japanese archipelago and the closest to Kamchatka, the local authorities issued a maximum level withdrawal order (5 in 5) to 10,463 citizens of the Urakawa Courage City. In addition, more than 1.9 million people in 21 municipalities along the Japan Pacific coast have received level 4 withdrawal warnings, which appeal to the “removal of dangerous areas” - such as those near the sea and the mouth of the rivers - “as soon as possible before the situation gets worse”. SMG issued order However, weather and geophysical services yesterday issued a note to say that Macau will not impact this earthquake. It was only a forecast that “a small wave of tsunami” could reach the coast of Macao between 18h and 19h, “could cause a fluctuation of the water level of 0.1 meters or less”, without “significant risk” to the territory. Japanese authorities' evacuation orders are based on the warnings issued by the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA), which have been in force from early yesterday morning to virtually the entire Pacific coast of the archipelago, and which estimate the occurrence of tsunamis up to three meters high. Until yesterday afternoon (Macao Hour) had been recorded tsunamis up to 1.3 meters high in the locality of Kuji, Iwate City Hall, and 80 centimeters on the Nemuro Peninsula in Hokkaido, both in the north. A 30 centimeter tsunami was also observed in the port of Yokohama, south of Tokyo.

item.title: Chikungunya | Announced Sixth Resident Infection
item.description:
With the number of chikungunya fever cases rising in recent days, the secretary for social affairs and culture, LAM has visited shipyards and public parks, where it was filmed by government propaganda teams
A resident of Macao living in Zhuhai was identified by health services (SS) as the sixth imported case of chikungunya fever. The information was released on Tuesday night through a Chinese language statement. According to official information, the man with chikungunya fever is 66 years old and was infected during a work trip to Sri Lanka, where she was July 7 and 18. He returned to the territory alone, but on July 21 he began to present the first symptoms of infection, such as fatigue, leg and knee pain and diarrhea. The next day, July 22, he developed fever and skin eruptions in the legs. As the fever did not disappear until the 26th, the man eventually sought treatment at the Conde São Januário hospital center. Finally, on July 27, the public health laboratory confirmed the new chikungunya fever case. The SS also explained that the case was categorized as imported due to the patient's “travel history”, “symptom development” and “laboratory tests”. Authorities also pointed out that the patient's condition has improvements. According to health services chikungunya fever is a viral disease, transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes, especially those of Aedes aegypti and aedes albopictus. Lam went to the ground With the number of cases increasing, the Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture, LAM, moved on Tuesday to some territory locations, where mosquito extermination actions are being carried out, such as workshoars, parks and gardens. The images of the visits were shared by the means of propagated from the government. The travel to the shipyards of the new landfills was justified with the fact that at least three of the cases of chikungunya fever identified in the neighboring province of Canton involving construction workers who work in zone A. "The possibility of transmitting fever through shipyards cannot be excluded," was considered by SS. By the time the statement was issued, the authorities also justified the reinforcement of mosquito extermination actions with the fact that five imported cases were recorded in Macao (the most recent case had not yet been disclosed), as well as a local dengue fever case.

He discussed long and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytizing. “Here is someone to whom belief brought weighting!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at one point a phrase that horrify me. He says, “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!” And I enter the voracious fauces of holism. Because holismo has a pathological aspect like all good things, a side of shadow. Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. In Africa it is not accepted that death may have been accidental, and many women are accused by the dead family of having caused her husband's death, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, in a huge injustice to his wife - madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Holism, in its pathological feature, can be the reductionism that is the way it puts the way as a new 'eschatological narrative'. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim committed himself and Lili married J. item.title: Diplomacy | Trump says he can meet with Xi “before the end of the year”
item.description: The president of the United States said yesterday that the meeting with his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, may occur "before the end of the year", considering that there was a "positive" commercial dialogue between delegations from both countries in Stockholm. “I look forward to the meeting, I would say that (it may happen) before the end of the year. It would be a way to close a circle, ”said Donald Trump, aboard the Air Force One, to a press question about a future meeting between both leaders, who had already announced last June. The president indicated that the commercial delegations of Beijing and Washington had "a very good exchange today [yesterday]" in the Swedish capital, allowing him to be more optimistic about the possibility of talking face to face to Xi. "If they had asked me yesterday, it didn't look very well ... Scott has just told me that the meeting with China did very well," Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, who leads the US conversation along with commercial representative Jamieson Greer, among others. The two -day meeting in Stockholm took place after the meetings in Geneva and London in May and June, respectively, and the telephone conversation between Trump and Xi, on June 5, in which the Chinese president invited his American counterpart to Beijing. Bessent and Greer have announced that they will meet Trump in the White House on Wednesday to inform him of the progress of negotiations and obtain their approval for the extension for another 90 days of the tariff truce agreed by both countries, which is expected to end on August 12.

item.title: Nissan | Losses of 677 million euros between April and June
item.description: Japanese automotive company Nissan registered a net loss of 677 million euros between April and June, the first quarter of its fiscal year, due to the drop in sales and the impact of tariffs. The third largest Japanese car manufacturer also had an operational loss of 462 million euros, while sales volume dropped 9.7 percent in homologous terms to 15.824 billion euros, according to the financial report published yesterday. The registered net loss is lower than expected by analysts consulted by Bloomberg, but reflects a situation still difficult for the Japanese manufacturer, involved in a large restructuring process. Although the evolution of its offer and fixed cost reductions “has allowed to alleviate losses, the group continues to face contrary winds, namely a decrease in sales volumes, unfavorable fluctuations of exchange rates and the impact of US customs rights,” Nissan says. The company maintains its predictions for the entire year 2025-2026, by 73 billion euros, but is excused to provide forecasts of profits or losses in a still very volatile commercial environment. Japan's car exports to the United States have been subject to a 25 percent surcharge since April by the Trump administration. Total customs rights to the sector should be reduced to 15 percent, according to a recently completed agreement between Tokyo and Washington. In this context, Nissan saw its sales in the United States, in number of units, retreat 6.5 percent from April to June.

item.title: Cambodia and Thailand reiterate in China commitment to ceasefire
item.description: Representatives of Cambodia and Thailand yesterday assured China's Deputy Foreign Minister Sun Weidong that their countries are “committed to the consensus achieved for ceasefire” after a border conflict. Sun yesterday received representatives of Cambodia and Thailand yesterday who, according to the Chinese Foreign Ministry, reiterated Beijing “their commitment to the consensus on ceasefire” and expressed “their thanks for the positive role of China” to alleviate the situation. The statement indicates that the meeting took place in a “frank, friendly and harmonious” environment and that the meeting demonstrates “China's last diplomatic effort”, which continues to play “a constructive role in supporting Cambodia and Thailand to peacefully resolve its border dispute”. Thailand once again accused Cambodia of “violating” the ceasefire due to conflict on the border, while PNHom Penh denies and ensures that he is “committed” to the hostility cessation agreement. Thailand and Cambodia agreed on Monday with a ceasefire after five days of clashes that left more than 40 dead from both countries, after a historical territorial dispute ended in a military confrontation at various points in its common border. Bangkok has already denounced on Tuesday the violation of the covenant by the neighboring country. To fulfill Cambodian Ministry of Defense spokesman Maly Socheata rejected the accusations yesterday and said that his country is committed to the signed agreement that came into force at midnight between Monday and Tuesday. After weeks of tensions on his border on Thursday, July 24, the confrontation for territorial reasons between the armies of the two countries, who mutually accused of having started the attacks. During the five days of conflict, at least 43 people died, 30 on the Thai side and 15 on the Cambodian side, while about 300,000 people were displaced, according to the latest official balance sheets. The ceasefire agreement was sealed on Monday with the mediation of Malaysia, a country that holds the rotating presidency of the Southeast Asia Association (Asean), while the United States and China participated as a co-organizer and observer, respectively.

item.title: Tsunami | Alert throughout the Pacific after giant earthquake off Russia
item.description:
A strong earthquake of magnitude 8.8 reached the Kamchatka peninsula yesterday in Russia, causing tsunamis in the country and Japan and the emission of alerts in many countries bathed by the Pacific
In the city of Severo-Kourilsk, in the north of the Russian Curilla Islands, several tsunamis flooded the streets and part of the two thousand inhabitants were removed, according to the Ministry of Emergency Situations. The state of emergency was declared in that area. "The fourth wave of Tsunami is coming. The wave is very large, everything is flooded, the whole coast is flooded," yesterday testified a inhabitant in a video published by the Russian newspaper Izvestia. According to the mayor of the city, quoted by the Russian state agency Tass, one of the tsunamis dragged to the sea the ships that were anchored. According to the United States Geological Institute (USGS), the 8.8 magnitude earthquake on the Richter scale occurred around 7:25 am in Macao, 20.7 kilometers deep, 126 kilometers from the Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky coast in the Far East Russian. This magnitude has been the strongest registered in Kamchatka since November 5, 1952, when a magnitude 9 earthquake, which occurred practically in the same place, provoked devastating tsunamis throughout the Pacific Ocean. Kamchatka's seismological service warned that replicas of up to 7.5 were expected. In Japan, images on television showed people to drive or walk to higher areas, especially on the island of Hokkaido, in the north of the country, where a first tsunami was observed 30 centimeters high. Fukushima (North) nuclear central employees, destroyed by a strong earthquake and tsunami in March 2011, were removed, the infrastructure operator said. “Do not venture into the sea and do not approach the coast until the warning is lifted,” said the Japanese Meteorological Agency (JMA), which provides for waves of three meters. "The inhabitants of the regions where alerts were issued should be immediately withdrawn to safe places, high areas or evacuation buildings," Japanese government spokesman Yoshimasa Hayashi insisted. The Japanese alert covers the entire north and east coast of the archipelago, to south of Osaka, as well as the small peripheral islands. Also, in Tokyo and Osaka bays, tsunami can reach a meter. The other Pacific China has issued tsunami alert to various areas of the coast. The Philippines also urged the inhabitants of the east coast to move inside and advised the fishermen who are already in the sea to remain deeply. The same message was broadcast on Hawaii, in the United States, threatened by waves of three meters or more. "People should not, and repeat once again, should not, as we have seen in the past, stay close to the coast or risk life just to see what a tsunami is like," said state governor Josh Green. Also Peru and Mexico said Tsunami's warning to the coast, as well as Ecuador, who evacuated the beaches and ports of the Galapagos archipelago. Tsunamis one to three meters are also possible in Chile, Costa Rica, French Polynesia and other archipelagos. The United States issued a series of alerts of different levels along the west coast from Alaska to the entire California coast.

item.title: Shanghai | More than 280,000 people withdrawn due to the co-may typhoon
item.description: Shanghai's Chinese metropolis removed over 280,000 people until 10am yesterday, due to the passage of Typhoon Co-May, the eighth of this season, which hit the east coast of China. In Shanghai, several districts raised their alert levels and, according to numbers cited by the local Yicai News Portal, the number of people taken from their residence areas exceeds 280,000. The authorities ordered the closure of some parks and tourist areas, suspended construction works and canceled classes in schools. The city dawned yesterday with heavy rains, with the local weather observatory warning that accumulated precipitation could exceed 100 millimeters (mm) over the next 24 hours. The co-may typhoon hit the east coast of China, where it is expected that in the coming hours, already degraded the tropical storm, continue to move northwest over Chinese territory. The storm hit the city of Zhoushan (East Zhejiang Province) around 4:30 am with winds of 23 meters per second at its center, according to the China Meteorological Center. Shanghai suffered in September last year his strongest typhoon since 1949, which left two dead in the neighboring province of Jiangsu.

item.title: Football | Two more former employees convicted of corruption in China
item.description: Two former Chinese football officials were convicted yesterday for corruption crimes, raising to 18 the number of people convicted since the beginning of 2022 of the largest anti-corruption campaign in recent football in the country. Liu Jun, former president of the Chinese Superleague Management company (CSL), was sentenced to a combined prison sentence and a fine of 1.1 million Yuan for accepting bribes, both as an employee and non-state agent. The court also ordered the confiscation of the profits obtained illegally by Liu, one of the main investigated in one of the largest cases of soccer corruption in China. Wang Xiaoping, former director of the Disciplinary Committee of the Chinese Football Association (CFA), received a 10-and-a-half year sentence and a fine of 700,000 Yuan for similar crimes. The incomes obtained improperly also confiscated. With these two new sentences, the number of convicts in the anti-corruption campaign that, since November 2022, has been shaken by Chinese professional football, affecting former leaders, coaches, referees and high positions of CFA. Among the convicts are prominent figures such as former CFA President Chen Xuyuan, sentenced to life imprisonment, and former national selection coach and local idol, Li Tie, who meets a 20-year sentence for accepting and offering bribes. The Chinese Football Association (CFA), now presided by Song Kai, indicated that its priority is to “rectify ethics in the sector and cement the foundations for a new long march towards progress”, alluding to the collective effort to rebuild Chinese football after scandals.

item.title: Analysis | Most dynamic local economies are no longer Beijing and Shanghai
item.description: China's most dynamic local economies are no longer metropolis like Beijing and Shanghai and became less known cities, including Hangzhou and Hefei, according to a new Economist Intelligence Unit report. Shenzhen was fifth, while Beijing, Guangzhou and Shanghai did not enter the Top 10 The conclusions of the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU) study, published on Tuesday, reflect a growing change in the country's economic scenario, as smaller cities affirm themselves as growth engines, thanks to the strength of advanced transforming industry, clean energies and other emerging sectors. The EIU annual report classifies Chinese cities in terms of growth potential, with Hangzhou - headquarters of the Electronic Trade Giant Alibaba, Artificial Intelligence Company Deepseek and several other major technology - leading the list for the fifth consecutive year. It follows Hefei, a city in eastern China known as the semiconductors and electric vehicles, and Chengdu, an important industrial center in the southwest of the country. Shenzhen, often nicknamed China's "Silicon Valley", was fifth, while Beijing, Guangzhou and Shanghai did not enter the Top 10. The results “reflect the rise of the transforming industry and the decline of the sector of services” in China, wrote economists Xu Tianzeng and Su Yue, in a context where the prolonged real estate crisis has been fought consumption and the economy remains dependent on production. According to the report, Hangzhou recovered robustly after the regulatory restrictions imposed by Beijing to the technological sector in 2021. "Since then, the city has reaffirmed its leadership in the Chinese race to artificial intelligence, driven by companies such as DeepSeek, while taking advantage of advanced transforming industry," said the authors, noting that Hangzhou has one position most solid inspectors in the country. Hangzhou is also the headquarters of the "six little dragons" - a group of prominent technological startups, including DeepSeek, the UNITEE Robotics Humanoid Robot maker and Neuralk's rival Brainco. The authorities of Zhejiang Province, where Hangzhou is located, have given priority to support to high -tech companies. Last week, they released an action plan project to boost local innovation, which establishes as a goal that more than 80 percent of new prices are from the technological sector by 2027. The report also points out that Hefei and Chengdu made “strategic and bold investments” in fundamental technologies to boost their development. Hefei has invested heavily in CXMT, one of China's leading chip producers, which prepares for an initial public offering, being widely seen as the country's best bet to compete with South Korea and the United States in the global semiconductor market. With feet and head Chengdu, in turn, invested in the Semiconductor manufacturer Hygon, a collaboration with the American AMD. “These enterprises not only generated substantial returns for both cities, but also launched the foundations for broader industrial ecosystems in neighboring cities,” the authors report. The metropolitan area that includes Chengdu, Deyang, Meishan and Ziyang registered an average growth rate of more than 7 percent in the first trimester of 2025, becoming one of the fastest growth regions in the country. Similarly, China's bet on clean energies is boosting strong growth in smaller cities with industrial bases linked to renewable energy technologies. Xinyu and Yichun, in the eastern province of Jiangxi, saw the growing demand for lithium -rich ores - essential for electric vehicles and energy storage - accelerate local growth. Already Jinchang, in the northwestern province of Gansu, registered an average annual growth rate of 12.9 percent between 2022 and 2024, driven by the search for renewable energy infrastructures, which streamlined the local non-ferrous metal industry. The report, however, warns that these smaller cities, driven by the energy transition, also face “vulnerabilities”, including exposure to raw material price cycles, foreign trade shocks and indirect industrial overcapacity adjustments.

item.title: Gaza | More than 60,000 Palestinians have already died in the war
item.description: More than 60,000 Palestinians died in the war between Israel and Hamas, which began 21 months ago, said the Ministry of Health of the Gaza Strip, controlled by the Palestinian Islamite group. The Ministry of Health of Gaza stated that the number of dead rose to 60,034, adding that another 145,870 people have been injured since the beginning of the war on October 7, 2023. Gaza's health authorities did not specify how many of these deadly victims were civil or combatants, but stressed that women and children represent about half of the dead. The United Nations and other independent experts consider the numbers presented by the Enclave health authorities as reliable counting of victims. The Israeli offensive destroyed vast areas of Gaza, dislocated about 90 percent of the population and caused a catastrophic humanitarian crisis, with experts and organizations warning of the severity of hunger in the enclave. The war suffered a drastic twist in early March, when Israel imposed a total blockade of two and a half months, preventing food, medicines, fuel and other goods. Weeks later, Israel broke the ceasefire with bombing and began taking large areas of Gaza, measures that, according to Israel, aimed to press Hamas to release more hostages. At least 8,867 Palestinians have been killed since then, according to Gaza authorities.

item.title: Panama Channel | China considers crucial neutrality
item.description: The China Embassy in Panama considered the neutrality of the Panama Canal, after a meeting with the interooceanic road administration in which areas of maritime cooperation were discussed. In social network X, the Chinese embassy wrote on Monday that "both parties exchanged points of view on exchange and cooperation in areas such as maritime matters and naval transport between [China and Panama], coinciding with the crucial importance of maintaining permanent neutrality of the canal." The meeting, held on Friday, in the channel's administration building, was led by Chinese ambassador in Panama, Xu Xueyuan, and the road administrator, Ricaurte Vásquez, as part of a "courtesy" visit, said the Panama Canal Authority (ACP) in a statement. According to ACP, Vásquez and Subadministador, Ilya Espino de Marotta, with the Chinese delegation a “cordial dialogue on topics of common interest, including cooperation in maritime trade, technological innovation and sustainability”. The meeting takes place at a time of reiterated US accusations about China's alleged "evil influence" on the channel, rejected by both the Chinese and Panamian government. This month, the Chinese embassy spokesman in Panama criticized the "lies" that the US ambassador in the country "repeats even exhaustion about China and Sino-Panamian relations." Based on the alleged Chinese interference with the Panama Channel, US President Donald Trump threatened to “recover” the US road, built and operated by the last century until its transfer to the Panamian state 25 years ago.

item.title: Anabela Santiago, Academic: “China is a reformist and moderate”
item.description:
Anabela Santiago has just defended at the University of Aveiro the doctoral thesis that analyzes how China has been positioned in recent decades as an important actor in the “global health governance”. Today, Beijing seeks “alternative mechanisms” of cooperation in the “global south” and tries to build an alternative model to the World Health Organization
Let's start with the concept of Global Health Governance (GGS). Is this a more contemporary concept or relating to the post-war period and the Foundation of the World Health Organization (WHO)? What have been the main actors of this governance until China's growth? GGS is a concept whose prominence and relevance have grown significantly in the 21st century, largely driven by economic globalization and worldwide interconnection. Although global health has always transcended national borders, demanding multidisciplinary approaches and international cooperation, only from the 1990s it was made greater awareness of it. Historically, GGS has been predominantly influenced by western powers and neoliberal values. The main actors of this governance, until China's growth, were historically marked by interventions of entities such as WHO and non-governmental, predominantly American and European organizations. One of the findings of its doctoral thesis is that China has been progressively positioning itself in this leadership. This position started specifically when and why? Yes, China has been progressively positioned as a relief actor in the evolution of the GG system. Although it is not possible to point out an exact date of start, China has evolved from a relatively isolated country to a main actor in global political, economic and technological arenas. Its growing economic and political influence also represents a change in GGS's historical dynamics, and in the 1960s China tried to play a humanitarian health care role in neighboring countries and Africa. The thesis points out that China's experience can be seen as an example of what is achievable when a state chooses its own way rather than a pre-established model, aligning itself with the 21st century prediction as the "century of Asia." Did the pandemic years influence this position? How? Covid-19 pandemic highlighted the need for global health cooperation, as well as the potential consequences of the failure to prioritize global health. The thesis explores the evolution of the Health Silk Route before and after the pandemic, indicating that the pandemic years allowed greater awareness of the need for instruments such as the Health Silk Route as the most effective cooperation platforms among nations. Although not detailed in this specific section, it is implicit that the pandemic intensified China's performance in health diplomacy and health development assistance. Looking at the internal reforms that China has carried out in the health area, which highlights as the most important? I approach, in the thesis, the reforms of the China Health System and I point out that the Chinese governance model is a unique combination of state -oriented economic reforms and development by the state, incorporating elements of neoliberalism and authoritarianism into political issues in general, and the health sector is nothing different from the rest. One of China's mentioned contributions, recognized by WHO, is its primary health care model based on the recognized good practice of “barefoot doctors” (barefoot doctors). In addition, the thesis analyzes the main reform policies and their progress and challenges in the period 2009-2018, which comprise the reforms of primary health care, hospital and pharmaceutical reform. The “Healthy China 2030” program is also an important and ambitious reference of China's domestic reforms in health, also encompassing social determinants. Is Beijing's intention to create an alternative entity to WHO, or simply create an alternative movement that can coexist with WHO, in the context of the relationship with the global south? How could this work? The thesis suggests that China adopts a "dual approach": while integrating in existing global structures, forging simultaneously alternative paths, particularly through regional alliances such as BRICS and partnerships with Global South. This indicates an intention to create an alternative movement that can coexist and complement the role of WHO, rather than a direct alternative entity. China demonstrates a clear commitment to align the objectives of the “Belt and Road” initiative with the united nations sustainable development objectives, showing their willingness to present these initiatives as complements to the existing cooperation mechanisms in the international liberal order. President Xi Jinping's view of a “future community shared for humanity”, which includes the notion of a “global health community for all”, also points to a new perspective in international cooperation. Traditional Chinese Masks, Vaccines and Medicine (MTC): What are China's products or instruments to position itself as an increasingly global actor in GGS? The thesis points out that China is an indispensable provider of global public health, essential for the product supply chain, such as masks and vaccines. The MTC is also mentioned as one of China's great contributions to global health governance, with its chinese herbal treatments, some of which already recognized by WHO in 2017. In addition, Chinese medical assistance and medical teams sent to other regions of the globe are important instruments of Chinese health diplomacy. In creating an alternative movement or reality to WHO, China may be taking advantage of the lack of full representativeness in the same WHO, or gaps in its operation? The thesis does not address directly whether China is taking advantage of a lack of full representativeness in WHO or gaps in its operation. However, it emphasizes that the work aims to fill a gap in scientific knowledge in relation to the paradigm of health governance from a non-western and liberal perspective, emphasizing China as an actor of the global south. This suggests that China seeks to strengthen alternative models that can offer more personalized health challenges, different from those defended by Western countries, positioning itself as a moderate reformist actor. How has the European Union (EU) foreign policy in relation to China affecting or influenced this position of the country in global health governance? In the thesis, the fourth publication, entitled "Challenges on the European Union-China Cooperation in Higher Education from" People-To-People Dialogue ’Perspective: The Case of Health-Related Joint Projects," explores cooperation in higher education, in particular that includes health-related projects. Therefore, despite the strategic and economic dialogue, the deterioration of UE-china bilateral relations intensified, with the commission to assume a decline of enthusiasm due to “China's countermeasures to EU human rights sanctions, economic coercion and commercial measures against the single market, and the positioning of China in the war in Ukraine”. Although challenges and tensions are recognized, cooperation in higher education, including health projects, is seen as part of a broader picture of strategic partnership between EU and China. However, it is evident that there is no long tradition of health cooperation between EU and China in higher education, and that there are few joint projects compared to the general panorama. It is suggested that both EU and China should make more efforts to align medical study curricula and promote more joint research in areas related to health, infectious diseases, among others. In the Trump 2.0 era, and without pandemic, what could be China's role in global health governance? Although the thesis is published this year, it focuses on the preceding period and includes the pandemic, where it does not speculate directly on a future scenario of “Trump 2.0” without pandemic. However, the thesis argues that China is not just a participant, but a moderate reformist force in the formation of global health standards. Regardless of future political scenarios, their growing economic and political influence, strategic health diplomacy, internal reforms and initiatives such as the Health Silk Route will continue to shape their role in global health governance. The view of a “global health community for all” also remains a guiding principle for China's efforts. Does this power of China in GGS verify more with bilateral or multilateral agreements? The thesis suggests that China's power in global health governance manifests itself through both bilateral and multilateral agreements, but with a growing emphasis on certain forms of cooperation that strengthen their role in the global south and through alternative mechanisms. Although the thesis does not explicitly quantify the predominance between bilateral and multilateral, the focus on regional alliances (BRICS) and partnerships with the Global South (which often involve bilateral agreements and group cooperation initiatives) and the Health Silk Route indicate a hybrid approach.

item.title: Filipe de Saavedra, Teacher: “A Camões Interpretative Center in Macau is missing”
item.description:
Professor at the University of Science and Technology of Macao and a scholar of the presence of Camões in Asia, Philip de Saavedra understands that Macau is missing an interpretative center about the poet's life and work. The academic spoke yesterday at the National Library in Lisbon, about the correspondence written by Luís de Camões in Asia
He participated yesterday at the “from Lisbon to Goa: What the Letters of Camões” participated. What path does the East arise portrayed in these letters, and who were directed? The letters Camões wrote from Asia are in the order of the dozens. There is in them scholarship, philosophy, and also a lot of humor, sarcasm, and satire of humanist nature. Some were written from Ternate, others from Malaca, Macau, probably others from Cambodia, to recipients in India and Portugal. With the exception of the letters of Goa, where the identification of the writing site is generally present, maping those that were written during the rest of it would be a complex task. They are only given as written in Asia. Can you give examples of written letters in this context? I mention here two of the first he sent to the kingdom. The epistle whose first line is “The Poet Simony speaking” was written in January 1554, when Camões has just arrived in Goa, destined for his pupil, D. António de Noronha. It is a very emotional letter, giving it the storm that had plagued the Armada in the Cape of Good Hope, "seeing the death of the before me." Camões survived this limit experience aboard the São Bento ship, the only one to arrive that year to Goa, and which was lost in the turn of the Christmas lands, dying in this second bid the Captain Fernão de Álvares Cabral, and many of those who traveled with him. In addition to the news of his salvation, the poet was equally eager to tell his friend the expedition of D. Afonso de Noronha to Malabar, in which he had taken part in the previous month. In Irenal pages, Camões vehemently condemns the massacre of the few native troops by the “thick armed” of the disproportionate vice-king army. In his radical compliment of peace, the poet calls "true remedy" to the early death that cure the war crazes of those who want to live "by knights", for "who will walk by following the fero Mars always brings their eyes to their danger." Cruelly prophetic words: by irony of fate, at the moment the poet wrote these lines and sent them, that recipient diletus, for whose life he feared, already lay, lying during a military foray in Ceuta on April 29, 1553, only 17 years old. And the second letter? A year later, in January 1555, he wrote to a friend a different epistle in tone and in purpose, whose first line is "I wished so much", where he evoked the shock he suffered from the death of D. António, gathering a sonnet that had composed to his memory. It is clear that Camões also had great intimacy with this correspondent, who knew D. António and the poetry of Camões, Petrarch and Boscán. Interestingly, the letter includes some male lines, which Camões says they are mandatory in private letters, containing what can be called a resort conversation, so being worship or scholar did not prevent it if it were "bon vivant". The presence of Camões in Macau is still wrapped in a certain myth. What are the concrete tests of your presence in the territory? It is necessary to separate the waters. The landing of Camões in Patane's busty, then called “cave”, is surrounded by a beautiful legendary aura. But the presence of Camões in Macao, this is not involved in "myth", is a factual and historical reality, founded on a wide variety of testimonies, all independent of each other. Insisting on a chronology that contained in the sources, but which was flagrantly erroneous, it was deliberately sought to confuse the doubts that could have about his permanence in the sinned, although unjustified, with false doubts about the poet's stay in Macau, which are laughable and devoid of the minimum foundation. The joke ran a swimming, and little by little it was embedded in the collective imagination, to the point that some less informed people take it for a supposed “discovery” recent. However, nonsense was released in 1907, and soon dismantled in 1911 by Jordan de Freitas. Judge Eduardo Ribeiro put more “points in the iis” in this regard. In your time I will publish the full documentation about the presence of Camões in Macao, putting a definitive end to the mythical “myth”. What life did Camões in Macau? We can say that these two years were those of the greatest professional, economic and affective in his life. Is it written poetry? Constantly, as the dimension of the work attests. A significant part of “the Lusíadas” was composed here, although the poem had neither began nor ended in Macao. Not least in his life was that it was in Macao who publicly assumed a relationship with a young Chinese, most exactly the Tanka ethnicity of poor fishermen. This asymmetrical connection is not surprising and with a modest young woman: only disadvantaged families would not prevent daughters from relate to foreigners. This explains the fact that she left with Camões in 1565 to Goa, with concubine status. But the private vessel in which they followed, belonging to Chinese merchants, suffered a wreck by Cambodia, and Camões lost there the “kind lamp I loved so much”. It was only after his death that he would come to chrisma as Denamene, a Greek nymph of the waters, so that she could live forever in the ocean. The Chinese of Macao have a special relationship with Camões, such as the Portuguese and the Macanese. How is this relationship? It existed in the eighteenth century in Macao the first monument in honor of Camões, something that in Portugal only began to think about the following century. He even received an inscription on Chinese, and even a Chinese pavilion was built on his sanctuary. The Viscount of Juromenha says that in 1845 the Viceroy of Canton and Imperial Commissioner Ki-A there was worshiped Camões as the “Portuguese Confucius”. And rightly, Camões shares many aspects of the sages of Chinese tradition: he established a dialogue with the masters through the recreation of larger works, cultivated a millennial tradition (he gloss two thousand years prior to his own time), practiced itinerary as a source of "sagesse", said the primacy of poetry, conceived the rivers as mythical entities, even personifying them, even personifying them, even He showed a marked tendency to moralize, and epitomously his thinking in masterful sentences. What connection did Camões have with Goa? Unlike Macao, Goa raised in Camões mostly negative feelings.
